quizzes.question: Which attribute contains the URL address of the webpage that is loaded after a form submission?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The <form> Element[/h1]

HTML forms are used to collect information from the user.
Forms are defined using the [b]<form>[/b] element, with its opening and closing tags: [code format="html" ]<body>[b]
   <form>[/b]â€¦[b]</form>
[/b]</body>[/code]
Use the [b]action [/b]attribute to point to a webpage that will load after the user submits the form. [code format="html" ]<[b]form action[/b]="http://www.sololearn.com"> 
<[b]/form[/b]>[/code]
[note]Usually the form is submitted to a web page on a web server.[/note]

quizzes.question: Which value for the type attribute should be used for a password field?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The method and name Attributes[/h1] The [b]method attribute[/b] specifies the HTTP method ([b]GET [/b]or [b]POST[/b]) to be used when forms are submitted (see below for description):[code format="html" ]
[/code] [code format="html" ][/code] [note]When you use [b]GET[/b], the form data will be visible in the page address. Use [b]POST [/b]if the form is updating data, or includes sensitive information (passwords). POST offers better security because the submitted data is not visible in the page address.[/note] The [b]name attribute[/b] specifies a name for a form. To take in user input, you need the corresponding form elements, such as text fields. The [b][/b] element has many variations, depending on the type attribute. It can be a text, password, radio, URL, submit, etc. The example below shows a form requesting a username and password:[code format="html" codeId="30"] <[b]input type[/b]="[b]text[/b]" name="username" />
<[b]input type[/b]="[b]password[/b]" name="password" />
[/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2541" width="100%"]

quizzes.question: Which value for the type attribute turns the input tag into a submit button?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Form Elements[/h1]

The submit button [b]submits a form[/b] to its action attribute: [code format="html" codeId="33"]<input type="[b]submit[/b]" value="Submit" /> [/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2544" width="100%"]
[note]After the form is submitted, the data should be processed on the server using a programming language, such as PHP.[/note]
